speaker: Marie
text: [_v.o._] Um, you see, Dr. Crane, there's this man I'd like to go out with, but he's forty years old and he's never been married.  Do you think that means something?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it could mean he has a fear of commitment... or it could mean he's just been lucky!

speaker: Frasier
text: Marie, that was a joke.

speaker: Marie
text: [_sighs audibly_] Did I mention I'm calling from a pay phone?

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright, alright, Marie, um... I would say give him a shot, but uh... I'd keep that caution bulb lit.  Thank you for your call, Marie. [_punches a button_] Who's next, Roz? _Instead of handing him over to his next caller, Roz interjects with her own on-air opinion._

speaker: Roz
text: If you ask me, it's divorced people you have to watch out for. Someone's never been married - it might just mean they're a careful shopper.  Whereas your divorce will bite into any old piece of fruit without even giving it a squeeze first.

speaker: Frasier
text: The preceding was an unbiased opinion from my never-been- married producer, Roz, who, incidentally, has squeezed more fruit than Tropicana. [_irritably_] May we take another call, please?

speaker: Roz
text: We could, but it's time for a station break.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_surprised_] Oh.  Oh well then, we'll be right back after this. _He punches a button and removes his headphones, then enters Roz's booth.  She is already up and on the way out._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, didn't we just take a break?

speaker: Roz
text: The lot was full this morning - I had to park at a meter. I'll be right back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Fine, just hurry. _Roz pauses and turns back to Frasier.  Neither of them notice Bulldog come into the hallway, then bend over to tie his shoe._

speaker: Roz
text: [_pausing_] Do I have headphone hair? [_off his look_] Well, I may have to flirt my way out of a parking ticket!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just go!

speaker: Roz
text: OK, OK! _As Frasier re-enters her booth, Roz turns and runs - and flips, literally head over heels, over Bulldog, and crashes to the floor. Frasier rushes back out to see Roz lying on the floor and Bulldog getting up._

speaker: Roz
text: [_clutching her ankle_] Ow, ow, ow, ow!

speaker: Frasier
text: My God! [_hurrying over_] Are you alright?

speaker: Bulldog
text: I got the wind knocked out of me, but I guess I'm OK.

speaker: Roz
text: Ow, ow, my ankle!

speaker: Frasier
text: Here, Roz. [_bending down and touching her leg_] Does this hurt?

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright, there's no nerve damage at least.

speaker: Gil
text: Still, one ought to have an X-ray.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, come on.  _They start to help her down the hallway, with an arm around each of their shoulders._

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, Frasier, the show!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that's alright, Roz, I'll get someone to fill in for me.

speaker: Roz
text: No, I mean right now!  You've got dead air.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God! _He lets go of her, almost dropping her to the floor again, and rushes back into the booth.  Bulldog and Gil help a moaning Roz into a chair by the side. The former sits next to her and the latter kneels by her leg._

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_to Gil_] Take the shoe off.

speaker: Roz
text: [_in pain_] Oh, oh...

speaker: Gil
text: [_on removing her shoe_] Oh, dear.

speaker: Roz
text: [_worried_] What is it?

speaker: Gil
text: [_distastefully_] I see it's been a while since our last pedicure.  _Roz shoots a disgusted look at Bulldog.  FADE OUT_ **BED AND BORED**  _Scene Two - Roz's apartment The living room shares the same space as the bedroom, and Roz is seated on the queen-sized bed, her injured ankle propped up on a cushion.  She is trying to paint her toenails. The doorbell rings._

speaker: Roz
text: [_calling_] Who is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_from behind the door_] It's Frasier.

speaker: Roz
text: It's open.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Roz.  How were things at the emergency room?

speaker: Roz
text: Frustrating.  You know how it is - you're sitting there in complete agony and every crybaby with a gunshot wound waltzes right in ahead of you.  How was it after I left?

speaker: Frasier
text: It was OK.  Weird Bruce from Engineering took over for you. [_looking around_] That's quite a boot collection.  Wouldn't it be easier just to put notches in your bed post?

speaker: Roz
text: Those are mine.  You hate the way I've decorated, don't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  Matter of fact, I admire your courage.

speaker: Roz
text: [_noticing the box_] Is that for me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes. [_hands it to her_] Freud said that there are only two things we need to make us happy: work, and love.

speaker: Roz
text: Aw, thanks, Frasier! [_opens the box_] So you brought me work.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I thought answering some of the fan mail that had been piling up would give you something to do.  And remember, this time death threats don't get photos.

speaker: Roz
text: Who is it?

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_from behind the door_] It's Bulldog!

speaker: Roz
text: Shh!  Pretend we're not here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, you just said, "Who is it?" _He goes to the door and opens it.  We see Bulldog, clutching some white paper bags in his hands._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, Doc!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, Dog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, Roz! [_noticing his surroundings_] Wow!  The whole place is a bedroom! [_barks_]

speaker: Roz
text: What are you doing here?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well, I kinda feel responsible for you being on the disabled list.  So I brought you some deli.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing says I'm sorry like fatty meats.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_walking into the kitchen_] You got your pastrami, coleslaw... OK, where's the french fries?  I ordered french fries!

speaker: Bulldog
text: THIS STINKS!  THIS IS TOTAL B.S.! [_comes out of the kitchen_] That apron boy is gonna...! [_notices another white bag on the E-Z table next to Roz's bed_] Oh, here they are.

speaker: Frasier
text: To think he does it all without steroids.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_coming back out_] You want me to stick these in the oven?

speaker: Roz
text: Actually, I'm not really very hungry.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh.  Then I guess you're not thirsty either? [_pulls out a bottle of Wild Turkey_]

speaker: Roz
text: Glasses are on the top shelf.

speaker: Frasier
text: None for me, Bulldog.  I'm off to the opera.

speaker: Roz
text: [_desperate_] You can't leave!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_calling_] Hey, no ice cubes!

speaker: Roz
text: [_calling back_] Just chip whatever you can off the edge of the freezer. [_whispering to Frasier_] If you leave me, he'll hit on me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, with a sprained ankle?

speaker: Roz
text: You know what it's like in the jungle - they always go after the sick and the lame.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I'd like to stay, but I'm meeting people at the opera. I've got the tickets!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_entering with two glasses_] Here we go.  I'll get you more ice in a minute when the feeling in my forehead comes back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, curtain's going up. [_opens the door and turns back_] Listen, Roz, if you need anything, feel free to call me absolutely anytime.  Well, except for the next three hours, of course.  I'm at the opera.  Oh, no, no, no...  four hours, it's Wagner.  Um... oh, then I've got a late supper, then right to bed, I've got an early squash game... tell you what, let's just say call me absolutely anytime after four tomorrow afternoon. _He opens the door and exits, leaving Roz quite effectively in the doghouse._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey. [_clinks her glass with his_] This is nice.  You and me, having a drink together.

speaker: Roz
text: [_draining her glass_] Yeah.  It's been fun.  Bye! [_slams her glass onto the E-Z table_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: How come you only painted two toenails?

speaker: Roz
text: [_sighing_] 'Cause it hurts too much when I reach.

speaker: Bulldog
text: You want me to finish them for you?

speaker: Roz
text: No, please, it's OK.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, it's a nice colour.  Goes with the bruise.

speaker: Roz
text: Bulldog, I mean it.  Stop it.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, you got nice feet!

speaker: Roz
text: Really?  You don't think they're too big?

speaker: Bulldog
text: You kidding?  I could get this whole thing in my mouth, easy. [_starts painting her nails_]

speaker: Roz
text: [_semi-suspicious_] You know, it's really nice of you to do all this for me.  Kind of surreal... but nice.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, I figure if I'm nice to you... maybe you'll be nice to me.

speaker: Roz
text: [_pushing herself off the bed_] I knew it, I knew it!  You come over here acting all sympathetic, but you're still the same old horny, low-class slimeball you've always been!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, before you say something that ends up offending me... look, all I wanted to ask you is if, you'd be interested in producing my show.

speaker: Roz
text: [_shocked_] What?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, I'm not real crazy about the guy I got now.  And let's face it - you're the best producer there is.

speaker: Roz
text: You really think I'm the best?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, that goes without saying.

speaker: Roz
text: [_obviously won over_] Well, Frasier goes without saying it every day. [_sits back down_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well, you don't have to answer right now, just take your time and think about it.  But I gotta warn ya, when I set my mind on something, I get it.  I once wanted to interview George Foreman.  He said no... but I got him. [_starts painting again_] I had to paint his toenails FOUR times, but I got him! _FADE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's apartment Roz is seated on the couch, her injured leg in Daphne's lap. Daphne is giving her a massage._

speaker: Daphne
text: You've been wrapping your bandage too tight.  You've got to keep the blood flowing to the injured ligaments.

speaker: Roz
text: Daphne, that feels great.  Whatever Frasier's paying you, it's not enough.

speaker: Daphne
text: Actually, I'll need a raise to get me to "not enough."

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Martin, what's going on?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Niles bought me some new shoes!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_mock approvingly_] Oh yes, look!  They have tassels!

speaker: Niles
text: Aren't they exquisite?  Those shoes were individually handmade by an artisan toiling in a hilltop village above Florence. [_goes to the bar to pour himself a drink_] The man is a hero there.  It's an event when he completes a pair of shoes. They ring the cathedral bell and the whole town celebrates.

speaker: Roz
text: There's a town that needs a bowling alley.

speaker: Frasier
text: Evening, all!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello!

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Roz, Roz!  Did you hear the show today?  I was at the top of my form!  I did a brilliant job of cutting a narcissist down to size!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you, Niles. So...

speaker: Frasier
text: Ooh, Dad!  New shoes?  Do I hear cathedral bells?

speaker: Martin
text: Ring-a-ding-ding!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, I also wanted to apologize for leaving you last night.  I hope you didn't spend the whole evening fending off Bulldog's advances.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, no!  Bulldog's not so bad!  We actually had a good time!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laden with sexual innuendo_] Ohhh?

speaker: Roz
text: What "ohhh?"

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I couldn't help noticing he came in to work this morning wearing the same clothes he had on yesterday.

speaker: Niles
text: [_laden with double sexual innuendo_] Ohhhh??

speaker: Martin
text: [_walking back to his chair_] What's going on?

speaker: Niles
text: Roz slept with Bulldog last night.

speaker: Roz
text: I did not!  How could you think that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I mean - dropping by, bringing a little gift?  It was obvious he was after something!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, that's not fair!  Dr. Crane is always dropping by and bringing me little gifts and he's not after anything!

speaker: Roz
text: [_indignantly_] I did not sleep with Bulldog - he didn't even hit on me.  He did want something, though - he wanted me to leave you and come be his new producer.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_skeptically_] Oh, well!  I wonder why he said that!

speaker: Roz
text: Because he really wants me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, I think that goes without saying.

speaker: Roz
text: For his show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Roz, Bulldog knows the blunt approach won't work with you, so he's being more subtle.  But his ultimate goal remains to... well, to...

speaker: Roz
text: [_snappishly_] To what?

speaker: Niles
text: To play Aeneas to your Dido. [_pause_] Sorry you had to hear that, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, that's alright.  As usual, I haven't the foggiest idea what you're talking about.  [_N.B. In an earlier draft, the line was, "dip his biscotti in your latte."  Also, for lay persons, Aeneas is a figure from classical literature: a hero of the Trojan War who escaped to Carthage, and had a passionate affair with the queen, Dido, before abandoning her to go to Italy and found the city of Rome (or so Virgil tells us)._]

speaker: Roz
text: You know, this is so insulting.  You think Bulldog wants me to come work for him because he wants to get me into his bed.  It doesn't even occur to you that he thinks I'm a good producer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, don't you think you're being just a tad naive?

speaker: Roz
text: I'll tell you what naive is.   Naive is someone who thinks he can stand there and talk to me like that without getting a crutch up his butt!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I can see how he's manipulating you!  I'm an expert in human behavior!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, really? [_to Daphne_] Excuse me. [_stands up angrily_] I've heard your expert advice!  The only mental disorder you've ever cured is insomnia!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm surprised you had time to listen, what with being so busy with your ultra-demanding producer tasks!  Answering phones and pushing buttons!  My God, a cockatoo with a strong beak could do what you do!

speaker: Roz
text: Then hire one, because I'm taking the job with Bulldog!  _She picks up her crutches and storms out -- or tries to, but it's hard to do with a pair of crutches and only one good leg._

speaker: Roz
text: [_hobbling towards the door_] That's it!  I am outta here! [_and hobbling..._] Take a picture, 'cause I'm not in your life! [_still hobbling_] You have seen the last of me! [_finally reaches the door and says triumphantly_] Sayonara! [_realizes_] Oh damn, my purse.  _Roz starts hobbling pitifully back to the couch on her crutches, with everyone looking on.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four -- KACL Frasier is in his booth, as per normal, but he has a new producer in the form of Bruce._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Bruce, I see we are loaded with callers here. What line is next?

speaker: Bruce
text: What's your favorite number?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_tolerantly_] Three.

speaker: Bruce
text: Damn.  What's your other favorite number?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_annoyed_] Why don't you just let me handle this?  [_He pushes a button._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, you're on the line with Frasier Crane.  I'm listening.

speaker: Francesca
text: [_v.o._] Hi, Dr. Crane.  Um, my name is Francesca and I'm calling about my boyfriend.  Well, he says he loves me, but I just can't get over this fear that I'm going to come home one day and he's not going to be there.  I don't know. It probably stems from my childhood when my father left us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Francesca, you are suffering from a fear of abandonment. But trust me, I'm here for you.

speaker: Francesca
text: Thank you, Dr. Crane.  I'm always so afraid that people I count on will just disappear and I'll be left with... _Her voice is suddenly cut off, to be replaced by a disconnected dial tone.  Frasier stares at Bruce with truly ferocious venom in his gaze._

speaker: Bruce
text: Sorry!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_slightly panicked_] Francesca, please... we had a little technical glitch there.  But we were almost out of time anyway.  Please, if you'll call in tomorrow, I'll make sure you're the first order of business.  Please call.  Well, we're just about wrapped up here, folks... I'll see you tomorrow, Seattle. _Frasier removes his head phones, then walks into the producer's booth slowly, menacingly._

speaker: Bruce
text: [_cheerfully_] Good show, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: You think so, Bruce?

speaker: Bruce
text: Yeah!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, call me old-fashioned but when my show starts out with a screeching noise that could shatter crystal, then moves on to an open mike while I'm eating a bag of potato chips, then disconnects two manic-depressives and a woman with a fear of abandonment, I don't think it's a show we should be mailing off to the Smithsonian!

speaker: Bruce
text: Don't worry, man - you'll do better tomorrow. _Bruce gives Frasier a comforting, condescending pat on the back and leaves.  Frasier is incensed.  He begins to walk back into his booth just as Bulldog wheels his usual equipment in, with Roz following behind him with a clipboard._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, it's going to be a great show, Roz.  I can feel it.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, I'm psyched.  You've got about a minute to show time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, Doc!  Long week no see.  Hope you haven't been avoiding me because I stole your chick.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Bruce and I are getting along splendidly!

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, I heard Bruce.  What happened, the cockatoo want too much money?  _Frasier, unable to reply, smiles sardonically, and trades sarcastic goodbyes with Roz._

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: So long, Frasier.  _He just closes the door behind him when who should he run into but Gil Chesterton._

speaker: Gil
text: Oh, a moment, Frasier, please!  I'm sure word has reached your ear already about the _frutti de mare_ party I'm throwing to celebrate our fair city's great bounty from the sea.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes.  I'd love to come.

speaker: Gil
text: Well, aye, there's the rub!  You see, I've already invited Roz.  With this rift between you two, well, the tension in the air will be thicker than my _cioppino!_

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Gil, I'm sure that rift will soon be over.  Before long, Bulldog will prove that all he's wanted all along is just to get his hands on Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ooh... in fact that moment may have arrived.  _He peers eagerly into the booth to see Roz bending down to pick up some papers she's dropped._

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, she's bending over!  Oh turn around, Bulldog!

speaker: Gil
text: Oh, yes!  Isn't that what golfers refer to as "teeing it up?"

speaker: Frasier
text: [_excitedly_] Alright, he moves in... and he... [_dejectedly_] ...helps pick up the papers!

speaker: Gil
text: Oh, I'm so sorry, Frasier.  I too entertained hopes for low comedy.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Attention, sports fans! [_blows a whistle and hits his gong_] You're back in the doghouse with Bulldog Briscoe!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Let's talk football, Sunday's lock: Broncos over the Raiders.  Easy money, huh, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, right!  And men just want to cuddle.  L.A. humiliated Denver last month!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Wh-Wh-What?  Hey, do I tell you how to cook and clean? Denver's doo!  It's a complete no-brainer.

speaker: Roz
text: Well then, it's right up your alley!  _She toots a horn at Bulldog defiantly.  Frasier and Gil lean back from the window._

speaker: Gil
text: You know, I'm no sports fan - but they really are quite delicious together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, enjoy it while you can.  Bulldog can't keep his libido in check forever.

speaker: Gil
text: [_condescendingly_] Well, of course you're right.  And then Roz will come crawling back to you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes. In the meantime, I have to find someone halfway competent to produce my show.  How hard could that be? _RUN: Frasier's question is answered by the short scene that follows -- it is a montage of all the candidates Frasier auditions for the job of Producer, and is set to the song, "They Call Me Mr. Pitiful."  Frasier is seated in his booth in various stages of distress and disarray as the following people inhabit Roz's usual dominion:  -- an old lady who smokes so much Frasier can barely see her through the haze;  - a lady who obviously has a fetish for cats, having decorated the entire studio with pictures of cats and the control panel with a real live cat;  - an EXTREMELY well-endowed blonde who is greatly distracting when she bends over;  - an over-worked neurotic who gets too stressed by all the calls coming in, and eventually throws up his hands in despair;  - and finally, an old man (Ed) who seems to have fallen dead asleep in his chair.  Frasier is suitably worried.  He removes his head- phones and gets up, slinging his coat over his shoulder.  His shirt is un-tucked... something we don't often get to see in a well-groomed man like Frasier.  FADE TO: _ **NILES MEETS THE GOATBOY** _Scene Five -- Cafe Nervosa Niles and Frasier are standing at the counter, having coffee._

speaker: Niles
text: You think you had a bad week?  This morning, Maris and I woke to the sound of our gardener, Yoshi, hacking his way through our prize topiary!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Niles, I've never understood why you wanted your hedges to be sculpted into the shapes of animals.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we're both animal lovers.  But Maris is unable to have pets.  She, she distrusts anything that loves her unconditionally.  Anyway, there was Yoshi, drunk as a lord, swinging his hedge-trimmer recklessly over his head.  Before we could calm him, he had transformed Maris's prize stallion into some sort of obscene... goat-boy.  The poor woman is inconsolable.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank you, Niles.  You've been a great deal of help. There _are_ worse things than seeing one's career go down the toilet - I could have my hedges cut into unattractive shapes.

speaker: Niles
text: It's always about you, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry!  But I'm just the slightest bit panicky that I'm never going to get Roz back!  I've been waiting for weeks for Bulldog to make his move, and against all natural laws, he hasn't!  _At this point, Daphne enters the caf e, talking to Martin over her shoulder._

speaker: Daphne
text: Come along! [_seeing the two brothers_] Oh!  Hello! I thought we might run into you two here.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah!  Daphne and I have been out buying shoes. [_to Niles_] Oh, not that I don't appreciate the ones that you bought me, but... I thought I'd save those for special occasions, when only tassels will do.  But hey, get a load of these! _He turns and walks a few steps off, showing he's now wearing new sneakers, with little pressure-activated blinkers in the heels._

speaker: Martin
text: They light up when I walk away!

speaker: Frasier
text: Doesn't everyone?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I see Mr. Congeniality here is still spreading sunshine wherever he goes.

speaker: Niles
text: Apparently things didn't go very well on his show today.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, really?  Well, you know these things go in cycles. I mean, take Bulldog's show - he's just had one great show after another lately.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm... what could be your point, Dad?  I'm having trouble reading between the lines.

speaker: Martin
text: If you weren't so damn stubborn, you'd apologize to Roz, get her back on the show, and everybody'd be happy.

speaker: Frasier
text: As usual, you're overlooking a key psychological component in this whole issue.

speaker: Martin
text: You'd have to admit you were wrong.

speaker: Frasier
text: Exactly!

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't see what's so hard about telling Roz you were wrong.

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't understand.  You see, it's not the same as Dad being wrong, or your being wrong.  I have a degree from Harvard!  Whenever I'm wrong... the world makes a little less sense.

speaker: Niles
text: Frankly, I don't understand why you want her back at all. She's pushy and opinionated.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, don't you think you're being just the slightest bit sexist?  What's labeled "pushy" in a woman is called "assertiveness" in a man.  Gone are the days when women were shunted aside to bat their eyelashes prettily and say nothing.

speaker: Daphne
text: I quite agree.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_dismissively_] Oh Daphne, please, I can handle this.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, you've certainly handled it well enough so far!  If you ask me, it's time you get off your high horse, buy Roz some flowers and beg her forgiveness.  And don't be afraid to get your knees a little dusty.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry.  I'm just not quite ready to swallow my pride.  _Frasier turns to leave, and runs into his most recent producer, Ed, who is passing by._

speaker: Ed
text: Next time, wake me when the show's over. _As Ed leaves, Frasier's look of consternation shows just how close he is to the end of his rope._ [_N.B. The actor who plays Ed appears again briefly in[[7.04]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_4/everyones_a_critic.html "Everyone's A Critic") Everyone's A Critic._] **YOU CAN'T TEACH AN OLD BULLDOG NEW TRICKS**  _Scene Six - Roz's apartment Roz and Bulldog are up late, sitting at her dining table and working together on the program for his upcoming shows._

speaker: Bulldog
text: All right, Wednesday we've got the NFL Picks.  Then at the end of the show we do the "boner of the week."

speaker: Roz
text: No, we can't do that.

speaker: Bulldog
text: This is why I hate you.  You are always trying to change my tried-and-true format.  Why can't we do it?

speaker: Roz
text: Because I got you an interview with Wayne Gretsky.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_annoyed_] See, Way... [_realizes_] Wayne Gretsky?

speaker: Roz
text: Mmm-hmm.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_ecstatic_] Wayne Gretsky! [_hits the counter_] THIS IS AWESOME! THIS IS TOTAL BRILLIANCE! [_flings up his arms_] THIS IS... [_winces_] a pinched nerve.  Ah, ah, ah!  It's an old football injury.  I got my head rammed into a locker when I tried to interview Mike Ditka.  Ahh!

speaker: Roz
text: Here, let me help you with that.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Ah, this is great.  I can't believe it.  Wayne Gretsky, the great one.  Aah... Roz, you are the great one.  You are some kind of producer.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks.  I'm having a great time.  I owe you, Bulldog. I owe you big. _At those words, Bulldog's face twists into a diabolical, self-satisfied grin -- which Roz, being behind him, fails to notice. _

speaker: Roz
text: You know, I never would have thought this a couple of weeks ago, but you and I have great chemistry together, don't we?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Uh-huh.  I like chemistry.  I flunked it, but I like it. You got any of that, uh... Wild Turkey left?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, sure.

speaker: Roz
text: [_o.s._] You know, I got to be honest with you, Bulldog. When we first started working together, I never thought it would turn out like this!  Did you?

speaker: Bulldog
text: All along.  _He rips off his shirt without bothering with the buttons, and takes off his jeans. He's now wearing only shorts._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey uh, Roz, you'd better make mine a double.  I'm a double kind of guy.  _He has picked up a bag and is now taking out his "equipment." As she speaks, he places a vase with a single red rose on the end table next to Roz's bed, followed by a red candle._

speaker: Roz
text: Uh-uh!  You're only going to get a little.  There's a lot I want to do tonight, and I want you to keep up with me.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, well, uh...  _He takes a long white feather out of his bag and ponders where to put it for a while, then sticks it in his shorts._

speaker: Bulldog
text: All I ask is that you give me a couple of twenty-minute breaks.

speaker: Roz
text: What's that?

speaker: Bulldog
text: I uh... I thought a little music might be, uh, might be nice. _He has a handful of rose petals which he begins to sprinkle liberally around the room.  He turns down the bed covers and throws more petals down on the bed as he climbs over it back to his bag._

speaker: Roz
text: Can you concentrate with that on?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh yeah, yeah!  Actually uh, I find uh...

speaker: Bulldog
text: ...the distraction helps me.  _He takes out a kitchen lighter - the kind one uses to ignite stoves -- and then pulls out a pair of handcuffs.  He studies them for a moment._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Nah... second date.  Don't be pushy. [_he drops the handcuffs_] This is great, Roz... us working like this.  _He flicks on the lighter and lights the candle, then begins to heat up the rose petals on the bed, both to create an atmosphere of warmth as well as to make the roses' scent stronger._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, uh... did you and the Doc ever end up working...  _He accidentally sets the feather stuck in his shorts on fire, and he rips it out, throws it to the ground and stomps on it._

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Did you and the Doc ever, uh... end up working like this?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh yeah.  We tried it once, but he complained I talked too much.  _Satisfied with his impromptu decoration of the place, he flops back onto the bed, waiting for Roz._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, yeah?  I would have figured you for a screamer.  _Roz comes out of the kitchen at last with two glasses of bourbon -- and lets forth a truly delightful SCREAM.  She drops both glasses._

speaker: Roz
text: What the hell are you doing in my bed?!  Get out!

speaker: Roz
text: Get out!  I asked you over here to WORK, you disgusting pervert!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_stands up, half on the bed, half on the floor_] Hey-hey-hey! You're going to have to slow down!  I'm getting some mixed signals here. _Roz throws the pillow down, rushes to the end table and blows out the candle.  She then switches off the boom box, and gathers Bulldog's clothes up off the floor.  She dashes over to the window and opens it._

speaker: Bulldog
text: What are you doing?!

speaker: Roz
text: Is this clear enough for you?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey are you crazy?  My wallet's in there!

speaker: Roz
text: Get out!  Now!  _Yanking open the door, she does not see Frasier standing behind it, about to knock.  He is holding a large bouquet of flowers - obviously he has decided to come groveling back.  How fortuitous!_

speaker: Bulldog
text: Get out of my way, Doc.

speaker: Roz
text: [_embarrassment and despair_] Oh...!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_with quiet triumph_] I'm listening.
